alert.note: Alert for Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 1:09PM EDT until August 06 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Woodford County in central Kentucky... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 109 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area and flash flooding. Multiple roads within the county have been closed due to high water. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and will worsen over the next hour or two. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Versailles, Milner, Bonita, Mortonsville, Firmantown, Gaybourn and Pisgah. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
